title: Ghostbots as Persons: Agency, Responsibility, and (Pseudo)Personhood in AI Representations of the Dead
abstract: Explores philosophical and ethical issues surrounding AI-based representations of deceased persons, examining agency and identity simulation.

title: The Political Economy of Death in the Age of Information
abstract: Analyzes the digital afterlife industry's ethical and legal challenges, focusing on ownership and consent over postmortem data.

title: “We will never forget you [online]”: An Empirical Investigation of Post-mortem MySpace Comments
authors: Jed R. Brubaker, Gillian R. Hayes
abstract: Empirical analysis of how users post comments to the profiles of the deceased on social media, with implications for digital mourning.

title: All the Ghosts in the Machine: Illusions of Immortality in the Digital Age
abstract: A book exploring the psychological implications and illusions surrounding digital death, identity persistence, and remembrance.

title: Virtual Reality for Bereavement Therapy: Potentials and Challenges
abstract: Reviews current VR applications for bereavement therapy and outlines future challenges in design and implementation.

title: Ethical Design of Companion AI in Bereavement Contexts
abstract: Discusses ethical design considerations in AI systems used to provide emotional support during bereavement.

title: Emotionally Intelligent Agents for Grief Counseling
abstract: Explores how AI systems can be developed to understand and respond to users' emotional states in the context of grief counseling.

title: Digital Afterlife: Death Matters in a Digital Age
abstract: Examines how digital technologies shape cultural understandings and practices of death, mourning, and memorial.

title: Designing Griefbots: What is appropriate when digital avatars survive us?
abstract: Analyzes user interaction and ethical boundaries in the development of AI grief companions and digital avatars.

title: Can Robots Help with Grief?
abstract: Investigates the emotional and practical utility of robotic companions for users experiencing grief.
